sentences.english: But as it becometh women professing godliness, with good works.
sentences.chinese: 而要以善行裝飾自己，這才合乎稱爲虔敬天主的女人。

sentences.english: I offer my obeisances unto Lord Nrsimha, who speaks very sweetly.
sentences.chinese: 我虔敬地頂拜主尼星哈，您的語言是如此的甜美。

sentences.english: With their mouths the godless would destroy their neighbors, but by knowledge the righteous are delivered.
sentences.chinese: 不虔敬的人用口敗壞鄰居，義人卻因知識得救。

sentences.english: But be continually with a holy man, whomsoever thou shalt know to observe the fear of God.
sentences.chinese: 只該同虔敬的人，常有來往，你知道他是遵守誡命的。

sentences.english: “Thanks be to God,” Mr. Sharkawi said of the Nile River water.
sentences.chinese: “感謝上帝，”談及尼羅河水時，薩卡維虔敬地說道。

sentences.english: The fear of the Lord is the religiousness of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 敬畏上主是知識的虔敬。

sentences.english: He prayed to God night and day endue him with the spirit of holiness.
sentences.chinese: 他日夜祈求上帝賦予他虔敬的心。

definition: to maintain/to adhere to/to observe (an injunction etc)
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
